articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Major in F# (Shape: E)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Major in F# (Shape: E)

## Overview
An arpeggio is a musical technique where the notes of a chord are played one after the other instead of simultaneously. The Major arpeggio in F# consists of the notes F#, A#, and C#.

## Notes and Intervals
- F# (Root)
- A# (Major Third)
- C# (Perfect Fifth)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This arpeggio is commonly used in various genres, including classical, jazz, and pop music. In a major key, the major arpeggio in F# carries a bright and uplifting sound, often conveying feelings of happiness and positivity. It can evoke a sense of resolution and completeness when used in compositions.

## Example Songs
1. "Sweet Child o' Mine" by Guns N' Roses - This iconic rock song features a memorable guitar riff that includes the F# major arpeggio.
2. "Canon in D" by Johann Pachelbel - This classical piece showcases the beauty of arpeggios, including variations that highlight the F# major arpeggio.
3. "Don't Stop Believin'" by Journey - The keyboard intro of this classic rock anthem incorporates the F# major arpeggio in a powerful and melodic way.
